children.value: ‚úì 3 GB free disk space (Miniforge ~400 MB + packages ~1-2 GB)
‚úì Stable internet connection (will download ~800 MB total)
: Use eduroam WiFi, not guest network (firewall issues)
Your computer probably already has Python, but it‚Äôs used by your operating system. Touching it could break things. We need:
: Separate from system Python (that‚Äôs what Miniforge provides)
: A bubble for course packages (that‚Äôs the conda environment)
: A professional tool for writing code (that‚Äôs VS Code)
Think of it like setting up a chemistry lab‚Äîyou need the right equipment in a clean, isolated space where experiments won‚Äôt affect anything else.
For deeper understanding of conda and environments, see:
Copy-paste works! (Ctrl+Shift+V on Linux/Windows, Cmd+V on Mac)
Python + conda package manager (same as Anaconda/Miniconda)
Works identically on all operating systems
Minimal installation (~400 MB vs Anaconda‚Äôs ~3 GB)
(~400 MB): Just Python + conda + pip. You install only what you need.
(~3 GB): Pre-installs 250+ packages (Spyder, Qt, R packages, etc.) you won‚Äôt use.
(~400 MB): Minimal like Miniforge but defaults to Anaconda‚Äôs channel (fewer packages).
Anaconda also has commercial licensing restrictions for organizations >200 people.
For academic work, Miniforge is the best choice: minimal, free, and access to the most packages.
Find and click the installer for your system:
The installer (.sh file) will download to your Downloads folder
üçé Not sure which Mac you have?
2. Navigate to Downloads and run installer:

# Go to Downloads folder
cd ~/Downloads

# Check the file downloaded (should be ~80-100 MB)
ls -lh Miniforge3*.sh

# Make it executable (required on some systems)
chmod +x Miniforge3-*.sh

# Run the installer
bash Miniforge3-*.sh

:::{tab-item} Windows
:sync: tab2

:::{admonition} ‚ö†Ô∏è Windows Users: Important Notes
:class: warning

1. The instructor uses macOS/Linux and hasn't personally tested these Windows instructions
2. Most commands work in "Git Bash" (install Git first if needed)
3. Use "Miniforge Prompt" for pure conda operations
4. If you encounter issues:
   - Google the exact error message (in quotes)
   - Ask ChatGPT/Claude with the full error text
   - Post on Slack with screenshots
   - Find a Windows-using classmate!
The .exe file (~80 MB) will download to your Downloads folder
If the file is <70 MB, the download failed - try again
If you get security warnings, click ‚ÄúRun anyway‚Äù
Right-click ‚Üí ‚ÄúRun as Administrator‚Äù if you encounter permission issues
Check installation path matches what you selected
On Windows, use ‚ÄúMiniforge Prompt‚Äù not regular Command Prompt
Use the same terminal window throughout setup. If you accidentally close it:
An environment is an isolated workspace. Think of it as a clean room where we can install packages without affecting anything else on your computer.

# Create environment with Python 3.11
conda create -n astr596 python=3.11

# Activate your environment
conda activate astr596
Every time you open a new terminal, you MUST run:
No (astr596) in prompt = wrong environment = packages ‚Äúnot found‚Äù!

Package installation takes 5-15 minutes depending on internet speed.
If it‚Äôs taking longer than 20 minutes:
Try again with fewer packages at once
You have two options for package installation:

# Install all course packages at once
conda install numpy scipy matplotlib pandas jupyter ipython astropy h5py scikit-learn

# Install JAX and jax-related packages separately (can be finicky)
conda install jax jaxlib -c conda-forge
conda install flax optax diffrax lineax optimistix -c conda-forge

# If JAX fails with conda, use pip as fallback:
# pip install --upgrade jax jaxlib
This ensures you won‚Äôt forget to install something later when you need it!
Start with core packages and add others as needed:

# Essential packages (install these now)
conda install numpy matplotlib jupyter ipython
Add more when you need them:

# Scientific computing (Project 2+)
conda install scipy pandas astropy

# Machine learning (Project 3+)
conda install scikit-learn h5py
conda install jax jaxlib -c conda-forge

conda update numpy
conda update --all  # Update everything

conda uninstall package_name
# Then reinstall fresh:
conda install package_name

conda list  # All packages
conda list numpy  # Specific package version
Step 3: Install and Configure VS Code

children.value: Run installer for your operating system
Click Extensions icon in sidebar (or press
: VS Code remembers this choice per folder - set once per project!
That‚Äôs it! Add other extensions only as you need them.
üö´ Critical: Disable ALL AI Coding Tools

: AI assistants like GitHub Copilot will autocomplete your code, often suggesting entire functions or completing lines automatically. While this seems helpful, it‚Äôs catastrophic for learning because:
and Copilot writes the entire function (often incorrectly)
You won‚Äôt develop problem-solving skills or debugging abilities
You‚Äôll become dependent on suggestions rather than understanding
The AI often suggests plausible-looking but subtly wrong code
: Learn to think computationally first, then use AI as a tool later (after Week 8).
Search ‚Äúai‚Äù ‚Üí Disable any AI suggestions or completions
Search ‚Äúsuggest‚Äù ‚Üí Consider disabling autocompletion entirely for maximum learning
You‚Äôre here to train your brain, not to train an AI to write code for you.
Create a simple test file to verify everything works:

"""Quick setup test for ASTR 596"""
print("Testing imports...")

import numpy as np
print("‚úì NumPy works!")

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
print("‚úì Matplotlib works!")

# Only test JAX if you installed it
try:
    import jax
    print("‚úì JAX works!")
except ImportError:
    print("‚óã JAX not installed (that's okay for now)")

print("\nüéâ Everything is installed correctly!")
print("Your environment is ready for ASTR 596!")
: You see checkmarks and the success message!
Let‚Äôs make sure you‚Äôre comfortable with the basics:

# 1. Check your environment is active
conda activate astr596

# 2. Check what's installed
conda list

# 3. Create a simple plot
python -c "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt; plt.plot([1,2,3]); plt.savefig('test.png'); print('Created test.png')"

# 4. Open VS Code in current folder
code .
You‚Äôre ready for the course when:
Opening a new terminal and typing
VS Code opens when you type
You‚Äôve just accomplished what many graduate students struggle with for weeks. Your professional development environment is now:
Take a screenshot of your successful test script output‚Äîyou‚Äôve earned this victory!
On Windows, use ‚ÄúMiniforge Prompt‚Äù not regular Command Prompt
On Windows, try ‚ÄúRun as Administrator‚Äù for installer only
Check you own the Miniforge directory
Try installing packages one at a time

# Configure proxy (replace with your proxy details)
conda config --set proxy_servers.http http://proxy.yourorg.com:8080
conda config --set proxy_servers.https https://proxy.yourorg.com:8080

# Remove environment and start fresh
conda deactivate
conda env remove -n astr596
# Then go back to Step 2

# Remove unused packages and cache
conda clean --all
# Check environment size
du -sh ~/miniforge3/envs/astr596

It‚Äôs okay to take a break after Step 2 (environment creation) and continue tomorrow.
Your progress is saved! When you return:
Continue from where you left off
: Add this to your terminal config file (.bashrc/.zshrc):
: Open terminal every day, even for 5 minutes. Muscle memory develops fast!
Open VS Code in current folder

Everyone struggles with setup‚Äîit‚Äôs genuinely complex. But once it works, it just works. If you‚Äôre stuck after 15 minutes on any step, ask for help on Slack with your OS, the command you ran, and the full error message.
